description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Patong: Capture the Magic" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Patong: Capture the Magic

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the captivating Hanuman World, Three Monkeys Restaurant offers a unique dining experience amidst lush greenery. The restaurant seamlessly blends into the natural landscape, providing guests with stunning forest views while they indulge in authentic Southern Thai cuisine. With two kitchens serving both Thai and Bali-inspired Western dishes, this exotic oasis is a must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable gastronomic adventure. The atmosphere exudes tropical charm, making it a popular spot for capturing Instagram-worthy moments.

sources.snippet: Seamlessly blending with its natural surroundings, Three Monkeys Restaurant is as exotic as the jungle that surrounds it. Combining bamboo and palm frond canopies, Three Monkeys Restaurant is idyllic for any Instagram feed. Food lovers will enjoy their authentic Southern Thai cuisine and its creative plating.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Restaurants in Phuket

places.name: Three Monkeys Restaurant

reviews.text:
Tree Monkey Restaurant, Hanuman World Phuket

This is already my third visit to this amazing restaurant - and it just keeps getting better! Today, we came to celebrate Father's Day with family and friends, and once again, Tree Monkey didn't disappoint.

We shared a spread of flavorful, beautifully prepared dishes. Some must-tries include the Steamed White Snapper in Chili Lime Sauce, the restaurant's famous Deep-Fried Pork Knuckle, Crispy Fish Salad, Roasted Spicy Pork Ribs, and for my son - a delicious Beef Bolognese.

If you're a coffee lover, don't miss their Espresso Coconut or the Coconut Smoothie Coffee - a refreshing and unique twist on your usual caffeine fix!

We chose to dine outdoors, enjoying a relaxing lunch with scenic views and live music from a talented Filipino acoustic duo that added the perfect touch to the atmosphere.

A special mention to Mr. MJ, our server - he was attentive, always smiling, and very knowledgeable about the restaurant and the activities inside Hanuman World. His warm service made our experience even better.

Quick tip: If you're a walk-in guest, make sure to register upon arrival. They do get a lot of bookings and reservations, but the process is super quick - just scan a QR code, fill in your details, and you're good to go!

This place is highly recommended for family gatherings, celebrations, or even just a chill hangout spot with great views and amazing food. We'll definitely be back again!

We had a delicious meal here today without even making a reservation. We were seated right away. The staff is super friendly and very welcoming. We noticed that many guests were quite rude to the staff and behaved rather arrogantly. Not pleasant to see. The staff is very welcoming, so treat them with respect! They go above and beyond and take good care of you. We had a wonderful meal in a unique setting. There was even live music, which wasn't expected on a weekday. You get a big 10!

The food was absolutely delicious! I especially enjoyed the Tom Yum Fried Rice with shrimp and the Shrimp Burger ‚Äì both were flavorful and perfectly cooked. Despite the restaurant being quite busy, it's spacious enough that I was able to get a table without a reservation.

The only downside was the ongoing maintenance work, which made the atmosphere a bit noisy. Also, the outdoor seating could really benefit from more shade or umbrellas to block the sun during the day.

Overall, it's a beautiful place with great food and a unique jungle vibe ‚Äì definitely worth a visit!

places.generalDescription: The Big Buddha, officially known as "Phraphutthamingmongkhol-akenagakhiri Buddha," stands majestically at 45 meters tall atop Nakerd Mountain in Phuket. This stunning white marble statue is not only a significant religious site but also offers breathtaking panoramic views of the island, including Phuket Town and Chalong Bay. The journey to this iconic landmark is made easy with well-paved roads, despite some winding curves.

sources.snippet: Phuket‚Äôs Big Buddha is one of the island‚Äôs largest and most respected landmarks. The colossal 45-metre-high statue is perched between Chalong and Kata and offers the best 360-degree views of the island with superb sunsets over Kata and Karon beaches.

places.name: The Big Buddha, Phuket

reviews.text: it is very beautiful place. I recommend for every tourist to travel this place. There is also tiger park and sweety elephanst there. There is hiking and motorcycle tours also. We are walking back inte the beautiful nature trees till tiger park. I recommend.

Viewpoint is so beautiful. Big Buddha is closed right now due to a landslide but you can ride a motorbike up to the top. You can still see The Buddha Statue but you can't enter. Beautiful motorbike ride up there.
Food and drinks served at the top.
Bring Thai baht.

It is still closed when I am visiting it in July 2025. But the view near the Big Budha is really beautiful!!! And it is free. There is like a park for elephants. You can pay if you want to feed the elephants or ride the elephants. But it is better if you choose not to ride the elephants.

places.address: Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Malin Plaza is a bustling night market located in lively Patong, offering a wide variety of goods and street food. It's well-known for its beachwear, Thai spa products, and traditional handicrafts. The market provides a cooler shopping environment compared to other busy markets in the area. Visitors can explore tabletop stalls, re-purposed shipping containers, and more under a metal roof.

sources.snippet: Malin Plaza Patong is the best choice if you want to go market shopping in the busy and air-conditioned lanes. Here, vendors sell everything from everyday items like clothing to mobile accessories and an impressive range of souvenirs. This place offers a good balance of fun shopping, good cheap food and drinks are what many travelers want to experience in Thailand.
sources.shortName: Local Patong Attractions - Beaches, Shopping, and Gems

places.name: Malin Plaza

reviews.text: Such an amazing place! I was on the lookout for some Indian or vegetarian food, but didn't find much around. However, I did come across one food stall (you'll see it in one of my photos) - the people there were incredible! I asked for fried rice with just vegetables, and they totally nailed it. The taste was absolutely awesome!

Had a great experience here in the afternoon as well as the evening. There are many food stalls to choose from with different cooked foods as well as juices and desserts. The ingredients are all fresh and made to order. There is a lot of seating throughout the market and workers who pass by to help clear off tables. Towards the back of the market are souvenir/clothing stalls that offer a solid selection of clothes/trinkets that are good quality and priced fairly. Overall a great spot to grab a bite and get some souvenirs.
Definitely get the massive water coconut and mango sticky rice, that alone is worth the trip.

There was a wide variety of food options, from fresh seafood and Thai street food to sushi, grilled meats, and refreshing tropical fruits. I especially enjoyed the seafood, which was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. The fresh fruit smoothies were also a must-try!

The atmosphere was lively and welcoming, with friendly vendors and a great mix of tourists and locals. Despite being busy, the market was well-organized, making it easy to explore different food stalls.

places.address: 162, 51-52 Prachanukhro Rd, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Masjid Nurul Islam is a vibrant and colorful mosque located in the bustling streets of Patong, representing the rich Islamic heritage of Phuket. It serves as a serene sanctuary for Muslims, offering a space for prayer, reflection, and community gatherings. The mosque is well-maintained and provides a clean and spacious environment for worshippers. Additionally, it offers food after Jummah prayers and is conveniently located near halal food options.

sources.snippet: Masjid Nurul Islam, nestled amidst the bustling streets of Patong, represents the vibrant Islamic heritage of Phuket. This mosque stands as a serene sanctuary for Muslims, offering a place for prayer, reflection, and community gatherings. Located a short distance from M√∂venpick Myth Hotel Patong Phuket, Masjid Nurul Islam welcomes both locals and visitors, providing an opportunity to experience the rich Islamic culture of Thailand.
sources.shortName: Local Patong Attractions - Beaches, Shopping, and Gems

places.name: Masjid Nurul

reviews.text: Masjid Nurul Islam is a peaceful and clean space, offering a serene environment for prayer. The architecture is stunning, with beautiful design elements that add to the mosque's tranquil atmosphere. Additionally, the area surrounding the mosque is filled with plenty of halal dining options, making it convenient for visitors. It's a great spot for both spiritual reflection and enjoying delicious halal food nearby.
Same feel in others mosque around the world.. Alhamdulillah able to perform morning prayers here and enjoy breakfast in front of the mosque

A Peaceful and Welcoming Mosque
Masjid Nurul is a beautiful and peaceful place for prayers in Patong. The mosque is well-maintained, and the community is very welcoming. Whether you're a local or a visitor, you'll feel at home here. The Friday prayers are well-organized, and the atmosphere is truly spiritual.

places.address: 83 Phrabaramee Rd, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Patong Beach Bangla Walking Street, also known as Soi Bangla or Bangla Road, is the vibrant heart of Phuket Nightlife. The area is filled with bars and discos where visitors can enjoy drinks and play bar games. For those looking for a different experience, nearby night markets offer discounted shopping of souvenirs and local items along with a chance to indulge in Thai cuisine under the starry sky.

sources.snippet: For most visitors, the main pull of Patong is contained in three words: Bangla Walking Street. It‚Äôs jam-packed with beer joints, go-go bars and nightclubs. If you want to shake things up and get on down long into the night, Bangla is the top spot on the island of Phuket.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Patong Phuket

places.name: Patong Beach Bangla Walking Street

reviews.text: "Patong Beach Bangla Walking Street is an electrifying experience that awakens all senses. The vibrant energy is contagious, with dazzling lights, pulsating music, and an incredible mix of people from all walks of life. The street food is a culinary adventure, offering a tantalizing array of flavors. While it can be a bit overwhelming, the sheer excitement and buzz make it a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the heart of Phuket's nightlife."

Not my type of place defo. Super crowded, loud music, everyone's offering something or putting sign into your face with offers for drinks, night clubs with dancing girls that look like robots, prostitution etc Putting two stars only because I liked the food strip which is part of Bangla street and they offer fresh sea food but be careful because they cheat with scales and you pay more than you should but we've had the best tiger prawns with butter garlic sauce, they were huge and super delicious.

Bangla Walking Street, Patong Beach ‚Äì 4/5 ‚≠ê
Bangla Walking Street is the heart of nightlife in Patong Beach, Phuket. It's full of energy with mostly loud music in the night, flashing lights, bars, clubs, and street performances. A great place to experience Phuket's party scene. However, it gets very crowded at night, and there are some cleanliness issues. Still, it's a must-visit if you want to see the fun and wild side of Thailand.

places.address: V7VW+J48, Bangla Rd, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Freedom Beach, located in the lively Patong district, offers a serene and unspoiled setting. Accessible by boat or through an adventurous jungle trek, this 300m strip of white sand provides a peaceful escape from the crowds. With clear turquoise waters and lush greenery as its backdrop, it's an ideal spot for relaxation. Unlike other beaches on the island, Freedom Beach is free from noisy water activities like jet skiing and parasailing.

sources.snippet: From relaxing on Freedom Beach to shopping at Jungceylon and exploring the nightlife scene, here‚Äôs our pick of the best things to see and do in town.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Patong Phuket

sources.snippet: Freedom Beach is a 300-metre-long strip located in the southern part of Patong; it is rumoured to be one of the most beautiful beaches in all of Thailand with soft white sand and clear blue waters. What makes it unique is that you can be in a place with both amazing views, one with the jungle-covered hills and the other one with clear water and granite rocks on the Andaman Sea. One of the best characteristics about this beach is that as there is no overnight accommodation nearby, it is the perfect spot for getting in touch with nature and really enjoying the peaceful views and the beauty of marine life and its underwater kingdom.
sources.shortName: Local Patong Attractions - Beaches, Shopping, and Gems

sources.snippet: A short, 10-minute ride in a long-tail boat will take you from the hustle and bustle of Patong (on the west coast) to the heart of tranquility at Freedom Beach. One of the cleanest beaches in Phuket, this hidden masterpiece is the reason you came to Thailand in the first place‚Äìto marvel at its picturesque, virtually untouched beauty. Freedom beach offers a throwback to the way Thailand was before tourism turned its enchanting shores into a tourist hot spot‚Äî-dotted with quiet beaches, immaculate sand, and an atmosphere of utter relaxation.

places.name: Freedom Beach

reviews.text:
The descent to the beach is very difficult, and the return from the beach requires even more energy.

The length of the beach is approximately 330 meters - it is a small beach. It is immersed in the wild, tropical green of the jungle, it is very beautiful and interesting, its territory is divided into several areas by natural rock formations. There are few people and a lot of space.

The wide shoreline, hidden sunbeds and umbrellas, make this beautiful beach wild. Practically nothing has been changed here by human hands!

The flora is amazing: a large number of: different trees, massive shrubs, palm trees, beautiful stones and everything else.

The sand here is very soft, light in color. Turquoise, clear sea. Good depth and there are no low tides (watch the tides in the appendix)! Here is a coral reef, which is worth exploring, armed with a mask, snorkel and flippers.

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

The water is crystal clear and super clean gives off serious Fiji island vibes. Perfect spot for laying out under the sun, grabbing a cold drink, and just soaking in the view. No noisy water sports or banana boats, which is a huge plus if you're here to relax.
But fair warning: the hike up and down is no joke! It's steep and a bit rough, so definitely not for the faint-hearted. That said, if you're into adventure and don't mind breaking a sweat to get to paradise, it's 100% worth it. Feels like a hidden gem for beach lovers who enjoy a bit of a challenge.

This place was incredible but it is quite the journey to get to and from. We took a grab and I was quite nervous when we were driving in due to the steep, windy roads. They dropped us off at a booth that makes you pay 100 baht per person. After reading, they make you pay this for walking through their land to get to the beach. After walking about 10 minutes down some dirt path with stairs, we finally made it to some rocks that we had to climb down to get to the beach. Once there, we quickly realized why it was called freedom beach. There is weed everywhere, everyone is just chillin on towels and enjoying life. The vibes here are spot on and 100% worth the journey for couples and single people (not families). The journey back up seemed like it would be easier since there are stairs but the stairs were a joke because they led you to a pickup truck that costs 100 baht per person. The alternative was to climb up a mountain basically so my recommendation is to bring water and sneakers so you can get to and from the beach easily and safely. Also the grabs picking you up won't come all the way up to pick you up so that was quite a journey to navigate.

places.address: ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏®‡∏¥‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kalim Beach is a serene and peaceful spot situated adjacent to the bustling Patong Beach. It offers a quieter atmosphere and is home to popular dining establishments like Joe's Downstairs, SeaSalt Lounge and Grill, and the local Kalim Rim Lay. The beach is known for its calm neighborhood, providing an escape from the tourist crowds. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll or indulge in delectable street food offered by Muslim vendors in the evening.

sources.snippet: This beach is located in the north of Patong Beach and it is more traditional due to local Thai touches. Here, you will find a small street food market with several stands selling noodle soup, roti (pancakes), and Thai ice creams, as well as juices and soft drinks every day in the evening. Kalim Beach is one of the best surfing spots in Phuket where you can also watch or participate in the competitions during low season (May ‚Äì October).
sources.shortName: Local Patong Attractions - Beaches, Shopping, and Gems

places.name: Kalim Beach

reviews.text:
This beach is easily accessible and not crowded, with fine sand and clear water.
It's very tranquil, making it ideal for relaxing, sunbathing, and a gentle swim.

Directly near the coastline there is a road, noise from it does not create a cozy atmosphere. Traffic is frequent. To call this place a recreation area can be called with a great strain, rather it is an intermediate resting point near the waves, between the planned route. The beach itself is practically deserted (a sharp contrast to the famous tourist center Patong, north of which it is located), there are no sun beds and umbrellas, it is unsuitable for swimming. This is a medium-sized beach, its length is 900 meters.

In the evening there are a lot of locals here selling food and quick snacks, so at this time it is especially crowded, there may be a problem with parking.

The flora is not rich, all the greenery is across the road from the coast.

The water in the sea here is clean (the bottom is strewn with stones), the entrance is shallow. The sand is hard, yellow-gray in color. Kalim is exposed to the tides (follow them in the appendix).

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

After midnight quite, less people
Listening wave sounds it's cool.
But. By evening there's nights market street foods which is nice, effect traffic a lot.

places.address: W76V+WQM, Kathu, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand
